meanings.definition: The act of dissolving or breaking apart.
meanings.sent1: The dissolution of the sugar in water was quick.
meanings.sent2: The dissolution of the relationship was inevitable.
meanings.sent3: The dissolution of the candy in my mouth made me smile.
meanings.sent4: The dissolution of the clouds at sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The dissolution of the pill in my stomach helped me feel better.

meanings.definition: The termination or ending of something.
meanings.sent1: The dissolution of the meeting was abrupt.
meanings.sent2: The dissolution of the contract was finalized yesterday.
meanings.sent3: The dissolution of the game left everyone surprised.
meanings.sent4: The dissolution of the argument brought peace to the room.
meanings.sent5: The dissolution of the class signaled the start of summer break.

meanings.definition: The process of disintegrating or dispersing.
meanings.sent1: The dissolution of the sandcastle happened slowly.
meanings.sent2: The dissolution of the fog revealed a beautiful sunrise.
meanings.sent3: The dissolution of the crowd after the concert was chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The dissolution of the ice cube in the warm drink was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The dissolution of the leaves in the wind created a colorful whirlwind.

meanings.definition: The act of formally ending a partnership or organization.
meanings.sent1: The dissolution of the company was announced to the employees.
meanings.sent2: The dissolution of the business partnership was amicable.
meanings.sent3: The dissolution of the club led to new opportunities for its members.
meanings.sent4: The dissolution of the team marked the end of an era.
meanings.sent5: The dissolution of the marriage was a difficult process for both parties.
